alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:07PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Hot Springs, southwestern Johnson and northeastern Washakie Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 207 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms 8 miles southwest of Ten Sleep, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ten Sleep around 215 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dullknife Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
